StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Genetics of Hypertension Associated Treatment Study (GenHAT) Genomic Background of Blood Pressure Response to Thiazide Diuretic in African Americans

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The authors thank the participants and researchers of the Antihypertensive and Lipid-Lowering Treatment to Prevent Heart Attack Trial (ALLHAT) and REGARDS studies and those studies constituting the ICAPS consortium. ALLHAT was funded by NHLBI contract N01 HC35130. The GenHAT Genomic Background of Blood Pressure Response to Thiazide Diuretic in African Americans Study was funded by grant R01 HL123782 (M.R. Irvin) from the National Heart, Lung, and Blood, a part of the National Institutes of Health (NIH). Information on the ICAPS consortium can be found at https://icaps-htn.org. For publications, written, and/or oral presentations resulting from use of this data, please cite the following information: “The original data description for the GenHAT study can be found here: (Journal Citation __________)(PMID __________). The original data used for the analysis in this publication can be found in the NIH database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) under the accession number phs______.”
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Only full or expedited approvals are acceptable, and an ANNUAL IRB review is required base on the informed consents from the submitting institution.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)
